article.title: Speckle Interferometry at the U.S. Naval Observatory. XXII

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of observation is represented by a **plus sign** in Figure 1?
What does a **thick solid line** represent in Figure 1?
choices: The earlier orbit referenced in Table 6

multiple_choice_question.text: What does a **dashed ellipse** represent in Figure 1?
choices: The earlier orbit referenced in Table 6

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of observation is represented by the letter **\'H\'** in Figure 1?

choices: Epoch of the most recent periastron passage in years

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the orbital "**grade**" in Column 11 of Table 6 indicate?
choices: The quality of the data used for the orbit calculation
The reliability of the orbital elements
The number of observations used in the orbit calculation
The separation range of the pair

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following is **NOT** a Campbell element listed in Table 6?
What differentiates the two groups of orbits presented in Table 6?
choices: One group has errors associated with each element, while the other does not.
One group has longer periods, while the other has shorter periods.
One group represents visual binaries, while the other represents spectroscopic binaries.
One group has been calculated using the grid-search method, while the other has not.
